revised_title: The Influence of Phenolic Solutions on the Rate of Absorption by Seeds of Hordeum Vulgare
tldr: This study investigates the rate of absorption of various phenolic solutions by seeds of Hordeum vulgare and the factors affecting the rate of diffusion of aqueous solutions across semipermeable membranes. The research demonstrates that the rate of moisture absorption is influenced by the nature of the solute and its concentration, with phenolic solutions generally accelerating the absorption process compared to pure water.
